3D Engine Features

The display system is an important aspect of any modern title.

MicroForté's 3D technology has a list of cutting edge features that make it perfect for MMOGs. Highlights are seamless continuous terrain for boundless movement, a sophisticated character animation system, use of vertex shaders, and continuous level of detail applied to models to allow hundreds of characters on screen simultaneously.

General Features

  • Portal based scene handler for seamless integration of indoor and outdoor areas
  • Dynamic loading of scenery in chunks for continuous gameplay without loading interruptions
  • Dynamically updateable BSP tree based collision scene
  • Hardware T&L support
  • Pixel and vertex shader support
  • *.fx file support

Terrain

  • Efficient height mapped terrain engine
  • Multiple blended texture layers
  • Real-time self shadowing that changes with the time of day
  • Objects can leave marks on the terrain (eg.footsteps)

Object Modelling

  • Models can inherit animations and attributes from ancestors
  • SuperModels are dynamically built from component models
  • SuperModels can be dynamically updated
  • Animations and meshes can be shared across multiple models

Texturing

  • Animated textures
  • Render to texture
  • DXTC texture compression
  • Detail mapping

Animation

  • Skeletal animations with linear key-frame interpolation
  • Multiple animations are blended together with per node blend factors
  • Multiple animations sequenced with blend-in/out times
  • Morph engine with a weighted accumulative system
  • Simple Inverse Kinematics (IK) can be applied to any node
  • Efficient programmed vertex animation for detail objects
  • Animations selected automatically based on definable criteria (eg velocity)
  • Preprogrammed control over model motion (eg straight line, arc, follow)

Lighting

  • Dynamic coloured lights, lens flares and coronas
  • Dynamic fogging varied by location, weather & scripting
  • Player shadows mapped onto terrain and object geometry

Level of Detail (LOD)

  • Discrete LOD on meshes
  • Automatic LODing of IK, animation blending, skeletal complexity and physics
  • LOD controller adjusts the LOD factor in real-time based on client performance
  • Automated billboard generation for low detail representation
  • Animated detail objects generated automatically based on programmed rules

Effects Weather Effects

  • An animated, multi-layered sky with graduated sky colours and heavenly bodies
  • Advanced sunlight scattering for realistic solar effects
  • Dynamic clouds that catch the sun, change density and directly cause rain
  • Realistic storms including rain, snow and lightning
  • Rain drops splash on geometry and create ripples in water
  • Naturally fluctuating wind affects rain, snow, clouds and particle systems

Object Scripting

  • Standard Python 2.x with extensions for C++ integration
  • Complete Python interface to game engine
  • Write and test scripts from within the game environment
  • Dynamically reload scripts without losing object state
  • Client can transparently call functions on server and vice versa
  • Properties changed on server propagate to client automatically

GUI

  • C++ and Python interfaces
  • Scriptable event handling
  • Plug-in shader model for custom effects
  • Create and tweak GUI elements on the fly
  • Create layouts in code or XML

Other features

  • Programmable particle system
  • Interactive water responsive to object collisions (players, rain, etc)
  • Mobile spaces that players can enter such as moving platforms and vehicles
  • Entity path interpolation for movement smoothing
  • Flocking heuristics that efficiently simulate flocks of creatures
  • Resources can be stored in compressed archives

Performance Analysis and Debugging

  • Built in timers using RDTSC on all critical components
  • Real-time graphing of timed components
  • Watcher functions allow in-game editing of any source variable
  • HTTP interface allows access to game client data from web browsers
